column4: hi, i'd like ubuntu and vista and xp on the same disk. I've set my disks to use ext3 and I can not get them working with ntfs or fat32 again. I tried gparted in ubuntu and from a live cd but that didn't work. Any ideas?
delete and recreate them in xp disc thingy
shall I delete the partitions in gparted and recreate them in xp disc thingy. Because when I try deleting/recreating in xp disc thingy it won't let me.
thats what to do, leave them as blank space and then xp them
